00123 typedef enum
00124 {
00125 // Packed RGB formats
00126         PIXELFORMAT_NONE        = 0,
00127         PIXELFORMAT_GREY        = (1 << 0),
00128         PIXELFORMAT_RGB332      = (1 << 1),
00129         PIXELFORMAT_RGB444      = (1 << 2),
00130         PIXELFORMAT_RGB555      = (1 << 3),
00131         PIXELFORMAT_RGB565      = (1 << 4),
00132         PIXELFORMAT_RGB555X     = (1 << 5),
00133         PIXELFORMAT_RGB565X     = (1 << 6),
00134         PIXELFORMAT_BGR24       = (1 << 7),
00135         PIXELFORMAT_RGB24       = (1 << 8),
00136         PIXELFORMAT_BGR32       = (1 << 9),
00137         PIXELFORMAT_RGB32       = (1 << 10),
00138 
00139 // Bayer RGB format
00140         PIXELFORMAT_SBGGR8      = (1 << 11),
00141 
00142 // YUV formats
00143         PIXELFORMAT_YUYV        = (1 << 12),
00144         PIXELFORMAT_UYVY        = (1 << 13),
00145         PIXELFORMAT_YUV420P     = (1 << 14),
00146         PIXELFORMAT_YUV422P     = (1 << 15),
00147 
00148 // Compressed formats
00149         PIXELFORMAT_JPEG        = (1 << 16),
00150         PIXELFORMAT_MPEG        = (1 << 17),
00151 
00152 // Reserved formats
00153         PIXELFORMAT_DV          = (1 << 18),
00154         PIXELFORMAT_ET61X251    = (1 << 19),
00155         PIXELFORMAT_HI240       = (1 << 20),
00156         PIXELFORMAT_HM12        = (1 << 21),
00157         PIXELFORMAT_MJPEG       = (1 << 22),
00158         PIXELFORMAT_PWC1        = (1 << 23),
00159         PIXELFORMAT_PWC2        = (1 << 24),
00160         PIXELFORMAT_SN9C10X     = (1 << 25),
00161         PIXELFORMAT_WNVA        = (1 << 26),
00162         PIXELFORMAT_YYUV        = (1 << 27)
00163 
00164 //      PIXELFORMAT_ALL         = 0x00003FFF
00165 } pixel_format;
00166 
00167 typedef enum
00168 {
00169 // One bit for each
00170         STANDARD_PAL_B          = (1 << 0),
00171         STANDARD_PAL_B1         = (1 << 1),
00172         STANDARD_PAL_G          = (1 << 2),
00173         STANDARD_PAL_H          = (1 << 3),
00174         STANDARD_PAL_I          = (1 << 4),
00175         STANDARD_PAL_D          = (1 << 5),
00176         STANDARD_PAL_D1         = (1 << 6),
00177         STANDARD_PAL_K          = (1 << 7),
00178 
00179         STANDARD_PAL_M          = (1 << 8),
00180         STANDARD_PAL_N          = (1 << 9),
00181         STANDARD_PAL_Nc         = (1 << 10),
00182         STANDARD_PAL_60         = (1 << 11),
00183 // STANDARD_PAL_60 is a hybrid standard with 525 lines, 60 Hz refresh rate, and PAL color modulation with a 4.43 MHz color subcarrier. Some PAL video recorders can play back NTSC tapes in this mode for display on a 50/60 Hz agnostic PAL TV.
00184 
00185         STANDARD_NTSC_M         = (1 << 12),
00186         STANDARD_NTSC_M_JP      = (1 << 13),
00187         STANDARD_NTSC_443       = (1 << 14),
00188 // STANDARD_NTSC_443 is a hybrid standard with 525 lines, 60 Hz refresh rate, and NTSC color modulation with a 4.43 MHz color subcarrier.
00189         STANDARD_NTSC_M_KR      = (1 << 15),
00190 
00191         STANDARD_SECAM_B        = (1 << 16),
00192         STANDARD_SECAM_D        = (1 << 17),
00193         STANDARD_SECAM_G        = (1 << 18),
00194         STANDARD_SECAM_H        = (1 << 19),
00195         STANDARD_SECAM_K        = (1 << 20),
00196         STANDARD_SECAM_K1       = (1 << 21),
00197         STANDARD_SECAM_L        = (1 << 22),
00198         STANDARD_SECAM_LC       = (1 << 23),
00199 
00200 // ATSC/HDTV
00201         STANDARD_ATSC_8_VSB     = (1 << 24),
00202         STANDARD_ATSC_16_VSB    = (1 << 25),
00203 
00204 // Some common needed stuff
00205         STANDARD_PAL_BG         = ( STANDARD_PAL_B   | STANDARD_PAL_B1   | STANDARD_PAL_G  ),
00206         STANDARD_PAL_DK         = ( STANDARD_PAL_D   | STANDARD_PAL_D1   | STANDARD_PAL_K  ),
00207         STANDARD_PAL            = ( STANDARD_PAL_BG  | STANDARD_PAL_DK   | STANDARD_PAL_H    | STANDARD_PAL_I  ),
00208         STANDARD_NTSC           = ( STANDARD_NTSC_M  | STANDARD_NTSC_M_JP| STANDARD_NTSC_M_KR ),
00209         STANDARD_SECAM_DK       = ( STANDARD_SECAM_D | STANDARD_SECAM_K  | STANDARD_SECAM_K1 ),
00210         STANDARD_SECAM          = ( STANDARD_SECAM_B | STANDARD_SECAM_G  | STANDARD_SECAM_H  | STANDARD_SECAM_DK | STANDARD_SECAM_L | STANDARD_SECAM_LC ),
00211 
00212 // some merged standards */
00213         STANDARD_MN             = ( STANDARD_PAL_M  | STANDARD_PAL_N    | STANDARD_PAL_Nc  | STANDARD_NTSC ),
00214         STANDARD_B              = ( STANDARD_PAL_B  | STANDARD_PAL_B1   | STANDARD_SECAM_B ),
00215         STANDARD_GH             = ( STANDARD_PAL_G  | STANDARD_PAL_H    | STANDARD_SECAM_G | STANDARD_SECAM_H ),
00216         STANDARD_DK             = ( STANDARD_PAL_DK | STANDARD_SECAM_DK ),
00217 
00218         STANDARD_525_60         = ( STANDARD_PAL_M   | STANDARD_PAL_60   | STANDARD_NTSC     | STANDARD_NTSC_443),
00219         STANDARD_625_50         = ( STANDARD_PAL     | STANDARD_PAL_N    | STANDARD_PAL_Nc   | STANDARD_SECAM),
00220         STANDARD_ATSC           = ( STANDARD_ATSC_8_VSB | STANDARD_ATSC_16_VSB ),
00221 
00222         STANDARD_UNKNOWN        = 0,
00223         STANDARD_ALL            = ( STANDARD_525_60  | STANDARD_625_50)
00224 } signal_standard;
00225

00230         IO_METHOD_MMAP,
00231         IO_METHOD_USERPTR
00232 } io_method;

00234 struct imagebuffer
00235 {
00236         int height;
00237         int width;
00238         pixel_format pixelformat;
00239         QVector <uchar> data; // maybe it should be a rawbuffer instead of it? It could make us avoid a memory copy
00240 };
00241 
00242 struct rawbuffer // raw buffer
00243 {
00244         uchar * start;
00245         size_t length;
00246 };
